title: SHORELINE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: SHORELINE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
SHORELINE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022.

Via email: public.records@shorelineschools.org

GOOD MORNING!

To whom it may concern,

WASHINGTON STATE OFFICE OF SUPERINTENDENT OF PUBLIC INSTRUCTION - EQUITY AND CIVIL RIGHTS (https://www.k12.wa.us/policy-funding/equity-and-civil-rights):

"The Washington State legislature notes that schools should be a place in which all youth feel safe. With racial equity as a central component of safety and security planning, it is imperative that all school safety and security staff not contribute to an unsafe environment for Black youth and youth of color."

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1.	Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2.	Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3.	Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

Note: If your agency chooses not to produce the requested records in reverse chronological order as requested, and/or chooses to sandbag this request by dribbling out a few records per installment every 6 months (tee-hee), you can expect a separate targeted public records request for each line item by year - submitted via multiple members of the public, multiple times until the requested records are timely produced. This simple three part multi year request would then become twelve (12) separate public records requests. If your agency would prefer 12 separate individual requests, please let us know.


PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERICAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Re: Washington Public Records Act Request: SHORELINE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
Good Day,

Shoreline School District confirms receipt of your request for public
records dated November 16, 2022 for school resource officer/school safety &
security staff program/school district law enforcement contracts and
agreements for 2019-2022.

Under Washington State RCW 42.56.520(2), the District is providing
notification that it will require additional time to locate and assemble
the records requested, to potentially notify third persons or agencies
affected by the request, or to determine whether any of the information
requested is exempt under state and/or federal statutes. Prior to
fulfilling your request, we will provide an update, as needed, as to the
extent of your request and the associated costs for fulfillment for
electronic or paper records.

The Shoreline School District policy 4040 and 4040p discuss various fees
related to paper and electronic records. There is a 15 cents per copy fee
for paper records, plus actual mailing charges, and various costs for
electronic records which may be efficiently reviewed here:
http://web.shorelineschools.org/school_board/policy_manual/content/4040P.pdf
. The District will assess the potentially responsive records and provide
an estimate to you prior to incurring any charges.

The District estimates completion of your request on or before January 31,
2023. We note your specific requests regarding fulfillment and chronology,
and will do our best to provide the records you have requested.
Best regards,

Jennifer
Assistant Superintendent Business & Operations
Shoreline School District

Good Day,

I am writing today to update you on the status of your request.

Unfortunately, due to staff shortages, we are extending the estimated date of our response to your request to April 28, 2023. The District continues to work to search for the records that are responsive to your request, review the records for responsive information, and will notify affected third parties as may be deemed necessary in accordance with RCW 42.56.

Best regards,

Jennifer

Jennifer Farmer
Shoreline School District

communications.subject: Re: Washington Public Records Act Request: SHORELINE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
Good Day,

I am writing today to provide an update in our response date. Due to the
volume of records and significant staff shortages, we will extend our
anticipated response date to July 31, 2023. Installments may become
available during that time, and you will be updated with installments or
cost considerations as our work continues.
Best regards,
Jennifer
Shoreline School District
Public Records Office

communications.subject: Re: Washington Public Records Act Request: SHORELINE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
Hello,
This is Shoreline School District's partial response to your request
received November 16, 2022 for the following:


   - * Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements
   your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the
   School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.*
   - * Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and
   all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security
   Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or
   noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to
   provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years
   2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.*

Per RCW 42.56.250, redactions have been made to secure privacy of personal
record information which includes: "...residential telephone numbers,
personal wireless telephone numbers, personal email addresses..."

There are no fees for the responsive items attached as the cost is less
than $2.00.

The District continues to work to search for additional records that are
responsive to your request, review the records for responsive information,
and will notify affected third parties as may be deemed necessary in
accordance with RCW 42.56.

   - * Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security
   Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the
   Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022,
   2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.*

We will extend our anticipated response date to August 31, 2023.
Installments may become available during that time, and you will be updated
with installments or cost considerations as our work continues.

Thank you.


*Public Records Office*
Shoreline School District
18560 1st Ave NE
Shoreline, WA 98155
Website:  https://www.shorelineschools.org/Domain/1177


*CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:* This email, including any attachments, may
contain confidential and privileged information which is intended only for
the use of the individual(s) or entitled named. If you receive this email
message in error, please immediately notify the sender by email and delete
it. Dissemination, forwarding, printing or copying of this email without
prior consent of the sender is strictly prohibited.  Thank you for your
compliance.

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (New Hampshire State Police)

communications.subject: New Hampshire Right to Know Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (New Hampshire State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: NH State Police Records Request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I'm writing to acknowledge your request pursuant to RSA 91-A, dated July 21, 2023 and received on July 21, 2023 requesting access to public records, specifically:

"All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes)."

Regarding the request for the report, in light of the scope of your request and the workloads and availability of personnel participating in the processing of your request, I estimate that 30 days will be reasonably necessary to determine the extent of available records in accordance with RSA 91-A and applicable case law.

Respectfully,

Mike Kokoski


Lieutenant Michael Kokoski
Commander, Policy & Compliance Unit

communications.subject: RE: New Hampshire Right to Know Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (New Hampshire State Police)
communications.communication:
Good morning, regarding your recent request, the responsive documents are attached. I believe these policies encompass the information you are looking for, however I am not sure what is meant by “vehicular response policy.”

Please note that Records and information compiled for law enforcement purposes have been redacted and withheld that constitute techniques, procedures and guidelines for law enforcement investigations whose disclosure could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law and whose disclosure could reasonably be expected to endanger the life or physical safety of any individual, including law enforcement officers. 38 Endicott Street North, LLC vs. State Fire Marshal, 161 N.H. 656, 661 (2012).

We will consider the request closed.

Respectfully,
Mike Kokoski

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Motor Vehicle Accident Report 23-067187 on 7/29/2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Body camera footage of Georgia DeKalb County Police Officer Shatasha Anderson # 3591 on 7/29/2023 around 15:30.  Officer Anderson took statements from two individuals at a motor vehicle accident at Candler Road near Ember Drive, case # 23-067187.  Officer Anderson stated in the incident report that her body-worm camera was activated.  We request the video of the entire event please.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Chavez

Barry Puckett | Deputy Director of Infrastructure | DeKalb County Government | Bobby Burgess Building | 3630 Camp Circle | Decatur, GA 30032 | Cell: 404.398.4797 | Email: jbpuckett@dekalbcountyga.gov<mailto:jbpuckett@dekalbcountyga.gov> | http://www.dekalbcountyga.gov<http://www.dekalbcountyga.gov/>

communications.subject: Fw: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Motor Vehicle Accident Report 23-067187 on 7/29/2023
communications.communication:
Hello Mr. Chavez,


After reviewing your request, it has been determined that the requested documents if they exist are subject to release under the Open Records Act, except those records that are part of an open investigation pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-72(a)(4). It will take approximatelyfive (10) days to search, retrieve, copy and/or provide the records and invoice. A cost estimate will be emailed to you soon; you will then let us know if you are willing to pay for the video or not.


Thank You,
David Rodriguez, Paralegal
DeKalb County Police Department
Open Records Unit

title: Request to Hendrick Hudson School District for Network Breaches and Cyber Attacks Records (2018 - Present)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request to Hendrick Hudson School District for Network Breaches and Cyber Attacks Records (2018 - Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I apologize for the oversight. Let's correct the date in the letter:

Jordan Lassiter
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: June 1, 2023

Hendrick Hudson School District
61 Trolley Rd
Montrose, NY 10548

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Records Pertaining to Network Breaches or Cyber Attacks 

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the New York Freedom of Information Law, Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by Hendrick Hudson School District pertaining to:

1. Any network breaches or cyber attacks that have occurred within your organization, including any records of unauthorized access, data theft, or system compromise from January 1, 2018 to the present.
2. Any internal investigations or reviews conducted in response to a suspected or confirmed network breach, including any reports, findings, or recommendations.
3. Any incident response plans or policies in place to address network breaches, including any procedures for mitigating and remediating the effects of such incidents.
4. Any communications between your organization and affected individuals, customers, or partners regarding network breaches or incidents.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with the New York Freedom of Information Law. If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log.

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation.

I also request a waiver of all fees in connection with this request as disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within five business days.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: 1-845-748-0329

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Lassiter,

Sorry this email is late.  However, due to staff vacations and  school year
preparations, we will require an additional twenty days to compile your
request.

Sincerely,

Carmen Koch
Records Access Officer
Hendrick Hudson School District
61 Trolley Road
Montrose, NY 10548
914-257-5112




-- 
This correspondence may contain confidential and/or privileged material and 
is only transmitted for use by the intended recipient.  Any review, 
retransmission, conversion to hard copy, copying, reproduction, 
circulation, publication, distribution, dissemination or other use of, or 
taking of any action, or omission to take action, in reliance upon this 
information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient is 
prohibited.  Any misdirection or other error in the transmission of this 
information is not and shall not be considered a waiver of any applicable 
privileges. If you have received this message in error, please contact the 
sender, delete the material from any computer, or other storage device or 
media, and destroy any and all hard copies.

communications.subject: Re: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request to Hendrick Hudson School District for Network Breaches and Cyber Attacks Records (2018 - Present)
communications.communication:
Jordan Lassiter

MuckRock News

DEPT MR  146407

263 Huntington Avenue

Boston, MA  02115

jordan@lassiter.eu



Re:       *Your Freedom of Information Request, dated June 1, 2023*



I am writing in response to your request, dated June 1, 2023 in which you
sought certain documents from the Hendrick Hudson Central School District
(the “District”) under the New York State Freedom of Information Law
(“FOIL”). The District previously acknowledged your request *via* email on
June 2, 2023.  The District will address each item of your FOIL request
below.



1.      As and for the first item of your FOIL request, which sought “[a]ny
network breaches or cyber attacks that have occurred within your
organization, including any records of unauthorized access, data theft, or
system compromise from January 1, 2018 to the present”, your request is
hereby granted.



2.      As and for the second item of your FOIL request, which sought
“[a]ny internal investigations or reviews conducted in response to a
suspected or confirmed network breach, including any reports, findings, or
recommendations”, your request is hereby denied.  There are no records
responsive to your request.



3.      As and for the third item of your FOIL request, which sought “[a]ny
incident response plans or policies in place to address network breaches,
including any procedures for mitigating and remediating the effects of such
incidents”, your request is hereby denied.  There are no records responsive
to your request.



4.      As and for the fourth item of your FOIL request, which sought “[a]
ny communications between your organization and affected individuals,
customers, or partners regarding network breaches or incidents”, your
request is hereby granted.  All records responsive to item “4” of this FOIL
request have been provided in response to item “1” above.







Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Law, you may appeal this decision
within thirty (30) days of receipt to: Dennis Lauro, Interim
Superintendent, 61 Trolley Road, Montrose, NY 10548 or 914-257-5112.





Carmen Koch

Records Access Officer








Carmen Koch, District Clerk
Administrative Assistant for the Superintendent
Hendrick Hudson School District
61 Trolley Road
Montrose, NY 10548
914-257-5112

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Cancelation of Political Rewind
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails, text messages and correspondence regarding the cancelation of Political Rewind with Bill Nigut and related programming changes at Georgia Public Broadcasting from May 1, 2023 to the present. This would include emails and text messages between employees and Commissioners (Brian Dill, Jerald Mitchell, Cecil Staton) of the Georgia Public Telecommunications Commission, also known as Georgia Public Broadcasting, employees of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution (employees possessing email addresses that end in @ajc.com), Cox Media Group (@cmg.com or @coxmediagroup.com), and Cox Enterprises (@coxinc.com, @cox.com, and @coxenterprises.com), the Gov.'s office and any members of the state legislature including panelists on the show.
Also any correspondence with NPR, the NPR Board of Directors, NPR's Public Editor, and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting over the cancelation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Patrick Bannon

communications.subject: Open Records Documents - RE: [EXT]   Georgia Open Records Act Request: Cancelation of Political Rewind
communications.communication:
August 9, 2023

Good afternoon,

Attached are the documents available that are responsive to your request. We searched as broadly as possible for all emails, text messages and correspondence regarding the cancelation of Political Rewind with Bill Nigut and related programming changes at Georgia Public Broadcasting from May 1, 2023 to the present. This would include emails and text messages between employees and Commissioners (Brian Dill, Jerald Mitchell, Cecil Staton) of the Georgia Public Telecommunications Commission, also known as Georgia Public Broadcasting, employees of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution (employees possessing email addresses that end in @ajc.com), Cox Media Group (@cmg.com<https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fcmg.com&c=E,1,t8h_5Hwzdnm6CJWebYll_OyBKhFS21CXs6_Cr4YpjuekN_ZhxH9hjVWpa-Chp24CuHN7yMhJ6LvFckIiUP5v7WQjuP4gSOmQjthIr7yu_2a931SXznCGYmxGDoXt&typo=1&ancr_add=1> or @coxmediagroup.com<https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fcoxmediagroup.com&c=E,1,ZSLUj5RJwKwi1_ZDSHfuL52dxsgR-81yTjjVJcJWQquRMVExFJAHj4Vry7Gorg6aIwT6BD8votqAd_ByCMkW6ytZrrLN1WB086F83kCPImp4REwQdP8q6vZwYI8,&typo=1&ancr_add=1>), and Cox Enterprises (@coxinc.com<https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fcoxinc.com&c=E,1,qFXfRkbohfwFX2t_fYSAXbqsqMF7EmLjTcZcyGfNBAdvun8QtQwsNfDOlfOl9xuEwatK39VPV5uYLhgbCHlhGCFtdyIPi4HE5AQKDx9VzVPXjHfyC6Nu34C8wQ,,&typo=1&ancr_add=1>, @cox.com, and @coxenterprises.com<https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fcoxenterprises.com&c=E,1,-gLMK7kWJ0dScYLCM5iCZrmxyV6_zyihCMjYSOczLjItDyl5_lqe6-6Lm7yZu8TzSBv2BVm5Sjv5NrLcoajclWsx0vCEMrYjolfW2FwhE98o6QEfGQ,,&typo=1&ancr_add=1>), the Gov.'s office and any members of the state legislature including panelists on the show. Also, any correspondence with NPR, the NPR Board of Directors, NPR's Public Editor, and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting over the cancelation.

These are all the documents that are available. The fee associated with this request has been waived.

Thank you.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NSO Group and Candiru Limited
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1)  Investigative records -- including cross-referenced records -- regarding, mentioning or otherwise pertaining the israeli company NSO Group AKA NSO Group Technologies
2) Investigative records -- including cross-referenced records -- regarding, mentioning or otherwise pertaining the israeli company Candiru AKA Candiru Limited
3) All FD-209 "Memorandum for Recording Contacts with Informants" and FD-302 "Form for Reporting Information That May Become Testimony" forms mentioning, containing or otherwise relating to "NSO Group", "NSO Group Technologies", "Candiru", "Candiru Limited" or the Pegasus spyware

Please conduct additional searches of the Investigative Data Warehouse (including IDW-S, SPT, DOCLAB and DOCLAB-S), Central Records System (CRS), SENTINEL and ELSUR, FISUR, TESUR indices. Please additionally provide the Administrative Case File, including all emails or other forms of communication regarding my request, processing notes, etc

The Department of Commerce has stated that “investigative information” had shown NSO and Candiru had developed and supplied spyware to foreign governments that used this tool to  "maliciously target government officials, journalists, businesspeople, activists, academics, and embassy workers". As such, this is confirmation such records should reasonably exist.

I ask that fees be waived for this request under public interest -- with NSO Group and Candiru recently placed on the Department of Commerce's and were described as "[being] involved, or is involved, or poses a significant risk of being or becoming involved in that are contrary to the national security or foreign policy interests of the United States" by the Department of Commerce, NSO Group, Candiru and their activities have been a major topic in the news and of public discussion. NSO and Candiru are not widely known to the public due to lack of details and as such records released will significantly contribute to the public's understanding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Quinn

communications.communication:

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I ask that fees be waived for this request under public interest -- with NSO
    Group and Candiru recently placed on the Department of Commerce's and were
    described as "[being] involved, or is involved, or poses a significant risk
    of being or becoming involved in that are contrary to the national security
    or foreign policy interests of the United States" by the Department of
    Commerce, NSO Group, Candiru and their activities have been a major topic in
    the news and of public discussion. NSO and Candiru are not widely known to
    the public due to lack of details and as such records released will
    significantly contribute to the public's understanding.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    1) Investigative records -- including cross-referenced records -- regarding,
    mentioning or otherwise pertaining the israeli company NSO Group AKA NSO
    Group Technologies
    2) Investigative records -- including cross-referenced records -- regarding,
    mentioning or otherwise pertaining the israeli company Candiru AKA Candiru
    Limited
    3) All FD-209 "Memorandum for Recording Contacts with Informants" and FD-302
    "Form for Reporting Information That May Become Testimony" forms mentioning,
    containing or otherwise relating to "NSO Group", "NSO Group Technologies",
    "Candiru", "Candiru Limited" or the Pegasus spyware
    
    Please conduct additional searches of the Investigative Data Warehouse
    (including IDW-S, SPT, DOCLAB and DOCLAB-S), Central Records System (CRS),
    SENTINEL and ELSUR, FISUR, TESUR indices. Please additionally provide the
    Administrative Case File, including all emails or other forms of
    communication regarding my request, processing notes, etc
    
    The Department of Commerce has stated that “investigative information” had
    shown NSO and Candiru had developed and supplied spyware to foreign
    governments that used this tool to "maliciously target government officials,
    journalists, businesspeople, activists, academics, and embassy workers". As
    such, this is confirmation such records should reasonably exist.
    
    I ask that fees be waived for this request under public interest -- with NSO
    Group and Candiru recently placed on the Department of Commerce's and were
    described as "[being] involved, or is involved, or poses a significant risk
    of being or becoming involved in that are contrary to the national security
    or foreign policy interests of the United States" by the Department of
    Commerce, NSO Group, Candiru and their activities have been a major topic in
    the news and of public discussion. NSO and Candiru are not widely known to
    the public due to lack of details and as such records released will
    significantly contribute to the public's understanding.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Michael Quinn
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fnso-group-and-candiru-limited-121061%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2OUyZW-3jnbyK8lotyHikw8

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.
An acknowledgement letter, stating the request is being processed.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1508739-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 111 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 895 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,929 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Blank  request Forms - FOIA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

 I apologize for any misunderstanding. To confirm, this FOIA request is distinct from previous ones, as I’m seeking empty templates of forms utilized by the Stamford Police Department for citizens to obtain Freedom of Information records, rather than completed forms over an extended period. If  further clarification is needed, please feel free to let me know.

 Please be so kind as to provide blank versions of any paper or electronic forms used by the City of Stamford Police Department from January 1, 2019, to July 15, 2023, for citizens making Freedom of Information requests. One copy of each form version, if multiple versions exist, will be adequate to fulfill this inquiry.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.
Police
Sincerely,

Robert Meehan

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Certain equipment purchases since January 1, 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Purchase records, invoices, procurement documents and other documents sufficient to show any and all disbursement of public funds for the acquisition by your agency since January 1, 2022 of any of the following:
• Firearms of .50 caliber or greater
• Patrol rifles (as commonly denominated for law enforcement use) or assault rifles (as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the California Penal Code)
• Wheeled vehicles that are built or modified to provide ballistic protection to their occupants, such as Bearcats or armored personnel carriers.
• Projectile launch platforms, such as 40mm projectile launchers, "bean bag" or specialty impact munition ("SIM") weapons, and "riot guns" used to disperse chemical agents
• Long-Range Acoustic Device (LRAD)

2. Purchase records, invoices, procurement documents and other documents sufficient to show any and all disbursement of public funds for the acquisition by your agency since January 1, 2022 of explosives and pyrotechnics, such as "flash bang" grenades and explosive breaching tools, and chemical weapons such as "teargas" and "pepper balls".

3. Records of deployment by your agency since January 1, 2022 of projectile launch platforms and munitions, such as 40mm projectile launchers, "bean bag" or specialty impact munition ("SIM") weapons, and "riot guns" used to disperse chemical agents; explosives and pyrotechnics, such as "flashbang" grenades and explosive breaching tools; and chemical weapons such as "teargas" and "pepper balls".

4. Records that include a glossary and/or explanation for "Purchasing Group" initials or abbreviations, as used in the CDCR purchases (see column D in "CDCRArmory_Spreadsheet" file of CDCR response to Public Records Act request # M003971-122821 in January 2022).

Please reference CDCR's response to Public Records Act request # M003971-122821 in January 2022. We see records of the same type and in a similar format at that request. We have clarified request #3 to indicate that we seek purchase records for munitions as well as launch platforms.

If you have questions about this request, please don't hesitate to contact me directly via phone, 510-282-8983 or email, jlindsay-poland@afsc.org.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: IAPro internal investigations (Auburn Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the listing of internal investigations in IA Pro with columns:
 Occurred date    Case/CAD/Incident No    Employee ID/Serial number    First name    Last name    Date hired    Incident type    Directive    Finding    Finding date    Action taken    Employee Type 

I request the listing be provided in Excel format so I can easily sort/filter it. Redactions should be done in Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P034499-072523
communications.communication:
Re:  Public Records Request concerning PRR P034499-072523 
 07/31/2023 Rose Terse MuckRock News, DEPT MR149822 263 Huntington Ave Boston MA 02115 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 25, 2023, Reference # P034499-072523 Dear Rose: Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520 and Doe I v. Washington State Patrol, 80 Wn. App. 296 (1996), this letter acknowledges receipt of your public record request addressed to the City of Auburn received by this office on  July 25, 2023. 
 Please be advised that the City responds to numerous public records requests pursuant to RCW 42.56.520 in the order received. Additional time may be necessary to clarify the intent of the request and/or gather and review records, to determine whether any of the information requested is exempt from disclosure, and to provide third parties with notice and the opportunity to seek a court order to prevent the release of record(s) in response to your request. At this time, we anticipate 30 business days to respond or provide an update to this request. A response can be the following: 
 
  *  A question about your request 
  *  An estimate on when your records will be delivered 
  *  A note explaining why the records cannot be released The documents you requested To view the full details of  this request please log into the Public Records Center.

title: DHS-OIG Report OIG-19-46 - Underlying Investigation Documents & Management Response

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DHS-OIG Report OIG-19-46 - Underlying Investigation Documents & Management Response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All materials relied upon by DHS-OIG in preparation of Report No. OIG-19-46, including, but not limited to, photographs, interview notes, and electronic or paper communications; 
2. All responses from Department of Homeland Security agency components, including, but not limited to, ICE, CBP, and Immigrant Health Services Corps, regarding the recommendations in Report No. OIG-19-46. 
3. All follow-up communications from OIG to any DHS agency component or Congressional liaison based on Report No. OIG-19-46. 
4. All communications between OIG and subject-matter experts, including, but not limited to, public health officials. 

Because the life and safety of migrants, including children, is at imminent risk as a result of the conditions documented in Report No. OIG-19-46, I hereby respectfully request Expedited Processing of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: DHS-OIG Report OIG-19-46 - Underlying Investigation Documents & Management Response
communications.communication:
I hereby appeal the agency's release of responsive records. It appears the agency conducted an inadequate search for responsive records, as multiple documents referenced in the substantive portions of the release are responsive to the request, but have not been produced. Moreover, the redactions applied, including fully withheld pages that have not been properly screened for segregability, fall short of the requirements of the Act. 

I request expedited processing of this appeal, given the significant public interest in this report, and the immediate danger to the health and safety of migrants imprisoned in the station and within the jurisdiction of actors described in this report, especially given their public, televised denials of findings the OIG detailed with which the agency previously concurred.

communications.subject: RE: FOIA Received # 23-24-0109; South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Columbia Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,



Thank you for contacting the City of Columbia Attorney’s Office.  Your request for information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, S.C. Code § 30-4-10 et. seq., has been received and forwarded to the appropriate department for review.  Please be advised that § 30-4-30(b) of the South Carolina Code authorizes a public body to “establish and collect fees” for providing information pursuant to a Freedom of Information Act request.  Prior to providing pertinent documentation, we will notify you of any fees associated with your request.



Once all documentation has been compiled and reviewed, non-exempt documents will be forwarded to you within 30 days, unless otherwise stated.



Effective May 19, 2017, it is a crime to knowingly obtain or use information obtained from a public body for commercial solicitation, S.C. Code § 30-2-50 et. seq.



Please feel free to contact our office if we may be of further assistance.



Sincerely,


[cid:image004.jpg@01D9BBDD.9A73FF00]
Elizabeth Williams
Public Information Officer, Office of the City Attorney
P.O. Box 667
1401 Main St, Columbia, SC 29202
Main Office: 803.737.0000 | Fax: 803-737-4258
FOIA@columbiasc.gov<mailto:FOIA@columbiasc.gov>

communications.communication:
July 17, 2023

Ms. Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau
MuckRock News, DEPT MR149226
263 Huntington Avenue
Boston, MA 02115

Re: FOIL Number NYSP-23-07-1082

Dear Ms. Coggins-Prioleau:
This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by New York State Police on July 17, 2023. The request was for "Vehicular Pursuit Policies (New York State Police)".
Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request, and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.
A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached on or before September 19, 2023, or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.
Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.
PLEASE NOTE: **
As we have acknowledged your request, please refrain from submitting duplicate requests for the same records through Open FOIL.  Submitting a duplicate request takes time away from processing the hundreds of requests received each month.  If you have additional information to add to your request, or you would like to know the status of your request, please contact the FOIL Unit via email or call us at (518) 464-7100, option #2.

Sincerely,
[cid:image001.png@01D9B898.80B55ED0]

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Response to HB7, "Stop WOKE Act"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) Any record reflecting any request for "guidance from the FLDOE" referenced in President Williams' January 11, 2023 memo to Chancellor Hebda, and any record reflecting any "guidance" received.

2) Any agenda for, minutes of, audio or video recordings (including Zoom recordings) of, or notes taken at any of the following meetings:
(a) a meeting on December 14, 2022  of the Council of Presidents
(b) a meeting on January 4, 2023 with Chancellor Hebda on the one hand and any member of the Council of Presidents (including President Williams) on the other;
(c) a meeting on January 5, 2023 between President Williams and Florida College System presidents, as referenced in President Williams' January 6, 2023 email with the subject line "Executive Order Framework";
(d) a meeting on January 17, 2023 at or about 6:30 p.m. with Chancellor Hebda on the one hand and any member of the Council of Presidents (including President Williams) on the other;
(e) the COP Professional Development meeting held on or about January 18, 2023;
(f) a coordination call held on February 2, 2023 by the Moore Agency. This meeting may have been attended by persons employed within the college's media/public relations staff.

3) Any copy of remarks presented (or talking points, notes, or similar preparatory materials) by President Williams at the February 1, 2023 faculty assembly.

4) Any emails (including attachments) sent to or from Williams.Tonjua@spcollege.edu which contain any of the "SEARCH TERMS" identified below. This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2022.

5) Any emails (including attachments) sent (on or after November 1, 2022) to, from, or between Williams.Tonjua@spcollege.edu, on the one hand, and any of the following addresses, on the other hand: agarciafalconetti@polk.edu, parkera@palmbeachstate.edu, probstc@scf.edu, cflax-hyman@gulfcoast.edu, dstephenson@nwfsc.edu, emeadows@pensacolastate.edu, lorenzg@seminolestate.edu, ghaile@broward.edu, BigardH@LSSC.EDU, henningj@cf.edu, richeyj@easternflorida.edu, jdudley1@fsw.edu, MURDAUGJ@tcc.fl.edu, joepickens@sjrstate.edu, John.Avendano@fscj.edu, grosskopfj@nfcc.edu, Jonathan.gueverra@cfk.edu, Katwater@hccfl.edu, kplinske@valenciacollege.edu, lawrence.barrett@fgc.edu, mpumarie@mdc.edu, Paul.broadie@sfcollege.edu, CLEMMONSS@chipola.edu, thomas.leitzel@southflorida.edu, timmoore@irsc.edu, beardt@phsc.edu, tlobasst@daytonastate.edu, Kathy.Hebda@fldoe.org, or Henry.Mack@fldoe.org

6) Any draft of the FCS Presidents Statement (also known as the "COP Statement on HB 7") issued on or about January 18, 2023.  This includes copies of any draft circulated by email and any Word version (including any redline version) sent to or from President Williams. This includes drafts circulated under any title, including (but not limited to) "FCS Presidents Statement", "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory", and "COP Statement on HB 7".

7) Any records reflecting or relating to the review on or about January 2, 2023 by Chancellor Hebda of the FCS Presidents Statement.

8) Any emails to or from President Williams concerning the "Executive Order Framework" as referenced in her January 6, 2023 email.

9) Any records reflecting the submission of a statement on HB 7 on or about December 14, 2022, as referenced in President Williams' December 14, 2022 email with the subject line "COP Statement on HB 7".

10) Any records reflecting any response to the December 14, 2022 submission from any state official or appointee.

11) Any text messages sent to or from President Williams and any member of the Council of Presidents on or after November 1, 2022.

12) Any emails (including attachments), text messages, or other communications between President Williams on the one hand and either Chancellor Henry Mack or Chancellor Kathryn Hebda on the other hand on or after November 1, 2022.

13) Emails (including attachments) sent to or from Matthew Liao-Troth or Jamelle Connor on or after December 1, 2022 containing any of the "SEARCH TERMS" identified below.

14) Any emails sent to or from President Williams or any person employed within the college's media/public relations staff, on the one hand, and the Moore Agency (including Kendra or Karen Moore: kendrap@themooreagency.com, KarenM@themooreagency.com), on or after January 1, 2023. 

"SEARCH TERMS" means any of the following comma-delineated terms: HB7, HB 7, House Bill 7, Stop WOKE, Stop W.O.K.E., CRT, critical race theory, governor memorandum, executive order, 23-021, #23-021

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Response to HB7, "Stop WOKE Act"
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

The Office of the General Counsel at St. Petersburg College is in receipt of your below request for public records. We will begin the process of identifying and compiling the records. Please be advised that records shall only include records already created and/or maintained by St. Petersburg College, its agents or business affiliates.

The College’s institutional policy is to charge a statutory surcharge for records that require extensive use of information technology resources and/or extensive clerical or supervisory assistance by personnel in addition to the actual cost of duplication, pursuant to § 119.07, Fla. Stat.  The charge for print copies is 15 cents per one-sided copy.  Should the production of the request warrant a surcharge for use of information resources and/or extensive clerical or supervisory assistance, an estimate will be provided.

Please contact me if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

[cid:image001.png@01D94773.2227B8E0]
Mia Conza
General Counsel
Office of the General Counsel
St. Petersburg College | SPC Downtown Center

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Response to HB7, "Stop WOKE Act"
communications.communication:
Ms. Conza --

Request Nos. 5, 11, 12, and 14 identify specific senders and recipients, the means of communication, and a limited range of dates of those communications. The requests are sufficient to objectively identify the requested records and are substantially narrower than request upheld in O'Boyle v. Town of Gulf Stream, 257 So. 3d 1036, 1042 (Fla. Dist. Ct. App. 2018). There, a requester sought "copies of text messages sent or received by the Town's Mayor since the time of his appointment." Id. at 1039. The court held that this was sufficient to establish a cause of action because it was, inter alia, "a specific request was made for all texts over a certain period of time." Id. at 1042. See also, e.g., State v. City of Clearwater, 863 So. 2d 149, 150 (Fla. 2003) (request for "all e-mails either sent from or received by two city employees over the City's computer network" over the course of one year).

Best,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Response to HB7, "Stop WOKE Act"
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

The College is in the process of compiling and reviewing the requested records. The voluminous number of records requested requires an extensive use of resources to comply. In addition, some of the information requested maintained in a format that is not readily available for production. Compiling this information requires a substantial amount of IT resources and labor costs to produce.  In accordance with 119.07, Fla. Stat., the estimate to review, redact, prepare, and produce the records is as follows:

  *   $64/hour x 16 hours = $1,024
  *   $157.50/hour x 15 hours = $2,362.50
  *   Total: $4,725

Please advise if you are willing to pay for the requested records. If you have any questions or need clarification, please let me know.

Thank you,

[cid:image001.png@01D963C1.B91FFEA0]
Mia Conza
General Counsel
Office of the General Counsel
St. Petersburg College | SPC Downtown Center

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

M. W.

title: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – FACIAL RECOGNITION  SOFTWARE (San Bernardino County Sheriff)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – FACIAL RECOGNITION  SOFTWARE (San Bernardino County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter.

 - Number, if any, of Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition-enabled equipment in place with this department or agency. Please specify if software has been purchased or if services are performed by outside contractors for the department or agency.  Please include pilot or testing programs within the scope of this request.

 - Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of  Facial Recognition software packages, Facial Recognition-enabled equipment or service agreements.

 - Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition-enabled equipment, including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

 - Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition-enabled equipment.


Please notify me when this information is available.

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project

communications.subject: [Document Released to Requester] San Bernardino County public records request #23-906
communications.communication:
San Bernardino County ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #23-906 along with the following message: August 8, 2023 MuckRock News Attn: Aaron Swartz Re: Public Records Act request # 23-906 Dear Mr. Swartz: The San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department (“Department”) has concluded its review of your Public Records Act request. Your request seeks information relating to Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition equipment. The Department has located the attached documents, which may be responsive to your request. Redactions have been made pursuant to Government Code sections 7927.700, 7927.705 and 7922.000. In response to your request for any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition-enabled equipment, the Department has conducted a thorough and diligent search and has determined that there has been none. Sincerely, San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department * DATAWORKS MAINTENANCE 21-22 Redacted.pdf * DATAWORKS MAINTENANCE 23-24 Redacted.pdf * DATAWORKS Sole Source 2022 Redacted.pdf * DATAWORKS MAINTENANCE Quote 38484 Redacted.pdf * CAL ID FACE REC Policy .pdf Document links are valid for one month. After September 8, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at San Bernardino County.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Azusa Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Law Request: Local level SAEC policies/data (Troy, NY)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (1977 N.Y. Laws ch. 933), I hereby request the following records:

Any and all statistics, data, reports, audits, policies, and procedures pertaining to the following items regarding sexual assault evidence collection (SAEC) kits (also known as "rape kits") and processing:

• all standard operating procedures regarding the SAEC process

• any written policies or procedures regarding department practices on the acquisition of or handling of rape kit evidence, including protocols for its collection, testing, and delegation and transfer to all other possibly relevant locations, laboratories, or agencies

• the number of kits collected and booked into evidence from the period of January 1, 2000 through the date this request is processed

• the number of kits that have been processed by a public or private crime or forensic laboratory or equivalent processing location from the period of January 1, 2000 through the date this request is processed

• the number of unprocessed kits in any storage facilities currently under the department’s jurisdiction and control, including those held by medical personnel or at external laboratory locations

• any materials regarding the status or ultimate disposition of cases in which a kit was collected. Please include all available segregable data.

• all audits involving this agency regarding the collection or backlog of SAEC kits

• all proposed alterations or yet-to-be-implemented changes to the policies and procedures regarding the collection, testing, and use of SAEC kits

If there any questions about this request, please feel free to call us at the MuckRock office at 617-299-1832.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Vanessa Nason

communications.subject: [Records Center] City FOIL Request :: C005626-080823
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: FOIL REQUEST of August 08, 2023., Reference # C005626-080823. 
Dear Vanessa Nason, 
My name is Frank and I started in the role of deputy director of public information in late March. 
I recently received a fax from a FOIL Officer within the Troy Police Department regarding this MuckRock FOIL case handled by one of my predecessors. 
They provided me with responsive documents and while I am told the documents were made available at the time, I am making them available again. My apologies if you did not receive these documents when the request was originally filed. 
Please click here to login and download the responsive records: My Request Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HYdxLOL2gU5oRgYdNVDNo6tmEoB1sva0K-2FO96Sv560Nl3-2Fb-2BSI2XmCLGv9Y-2BRy7g2A-3D-3DEXAu_qdvQVCWowAHpU54cRSj9g0poM8KwLK-2FvkCwaWYhINhgexm-2F-2F6LoIa8gXZbptbGVjgaRNd1sUAnzyzMcMNvTkd-2FnuhyiEt-2BaX-2FzcGVnctDTKaTTMgdDEkq-2FqUSrp75-2BklVRF5-2FY9yfSqb2015yWZAm5YHL7xo-2FQ-2FEKK1-2F0x80vP-2FV-2FVFPd5ALCjXrfc4K6RxfdSEMsgv2PHObAU2X-2FyWrVd1zdA4pfhzG2y7qpCCErO6LsQ2sQlw3zdHw0zk8ivj3NWMS2t-2B77NMhYVm5Sk6S8Nb-2Fb5kfwfUtJenBQJqP3L1NBFODy0GYxZMVaN7HOPo05pC91eXOONhCwqu4VF62T2Bj1RB8WRPfjUEsMlsFVCuuBmif84BeuzCAgFstiN3f) 
Best, 
Frank 
### 
This request is hereby closed. Any persons who feel they have been denied access to requested records may appeal the decision in writing within thirty days. Appeals should be mailed to: Richard T. Morrissey, Office of the Corporation Counsel, Troy City Hall, 433 River Street, Troy, NY 12180. 

To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the FOIL Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HYdxLOL2gU5oRgYdNVDNo6vTDL6Qc9e-2FDzVLfXF6X6pRxFGMPddsv7WN5HV47KY5T2iGGNBgAW6rfxC7zYgaff4-3Dabzy_qdvQVCWowAHpU54cRSj9g0poM8KwLK-2FvkCwaWYhINhgexm-2F-2F6LoIa8gXZbptbGVjgaRNd1sUAnzyzMcMNvTkd-2FnuhyiEt-2BaX-2FzcGVnctDTKaTTMgdDEkq-2FqUSrp75-2BklVRF5-2FY9yfSqb2015yWZAm5YHL7xo-2FQ-2FEKK1-2F0x80vP-2FV-2FVFPd5ALCjXrfc4K6RxfdSEMsgv2PHObAU2X-2FyWrVd1zdA4pfhzG2y7qpCCErO6BW52dvDOxPANTcvFs9qR2QzAEfYNCIllzN1-2FAEfysY0gnVSwYjgM3eyplw756zIL7qeqRMk-2FaldkcmAgal-2FJaTVXERQxGrHaqv7BKIj3T4gKADKhoNIZsrQHPCzkjEouh37qgScKI6hQALyK7gOOP)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 2018 EPA Radnet reporting Boise, ID
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, documents, correspondence, materials, presentations, reports, and data concerning missing/unreported RadNet system data from stationary air monitors located in Boise, ID between November 15, 2018, and November 27, 2018.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grant Michael Hill

title: FWS drone footage from flights as part of "Operation Border Surge"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FWS drone footage from flights as part of "Operation Border Surge"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all video footage from drone flights from July 26, 2018 through August 7, 2018 as part of "Operation Border Surge."

This missions were disclosed in a log of unmanned aerial vehicle missions released via a previous FOIA request. The remote pilot in command is listed as Shay Hurd.  The log lists the RID's as:

RID-18-3225
RID-18-3380

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: Live Birth Data by School District

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Live Birth Data by School District
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to make a Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request for information regarding the number of live births in each school district in New York State from January 1st, 2019 to the present date.

I understand that this information may be maintained by the New York State Department of Health, and I am specifically requesting that you provide me with that data. If any other entity within your jurisdiction maintains this information, please let me know so that I may direct my request appropriately.

Please provide this information in a machine-readable format (such as .CSV or Excel) if possible. If not, please explain why and provide the information in another accessible format.

I would also like to receive a certification, as required by Public Officers Law §89(3), stating that all public records responsive to this request have been searched and reviewed, that any record that can be located has been made available to me, and that the specific grounds for any denial of access are clearly explained.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Live Birth Data by School District
communications.communication:
Thank you for your response to my Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request for live birth data in New York State. While I appreciate the links you provided to the available data summaries, I would like to request all draft information and statistical tabulations and data for the years from 2019 to the present that you have readily available now.

I am aware that the New York State Department of Health has a legal obligation to respond to my request within 20 business days, as required by the FOIL law. If the department anticipates that it will be unable to provide the requested information within that time frame, I ask that you notify me in writing and provide an explanation for the delay, as well as a new estimated timeline for providing the responsive records.

Additionally, please be advised that any unreasonable delay or denial of access to the requested records may result in the filing of an appeal with the Records Access Appeals Officer, as well as other legal action as allowed by the FOIL law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
